meanings.definition: The act of infusing or the state of being infused.
meanings.sent1: Her gentle infusion of kindness made everyone feel welcome.
meanings.sent2: The slow infusion of tea leaves in hot water created a soothing beverage.
meanings.sent3: The infusion of joy in her laughter was contagious.
meanings.sent4: His words were an infusion of hope in a time of despair.
meanings.sent5: The infusion of colors in the painting brought it to life.

meanings.definition: The introduction of a substance into a vein or tissue.
meanings.sent1: The nurse carefully monitored the infusion of medicine into the patient's vein.
meanings.sent2: The quick infusion of the dye allowed the doctors to see the blood vessels clearly.
meanings.sent3: The infusion of humor into the situation lightened the mood in the hospital room.
meanings.sent4: The music was an infusion of energy into the dance performance.
meanings.sent5: The infusion of warmth from the heating pad helped ease the pain.

meanings.definition: The liquid extract obtained by steeping or soaking a substance in water or other liquid.
meanings.sent1: She added a drop of vanilla infusion to the cake batter for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: The herbal infusion of chamomile and lavender was perfect for relaxation.
meanings.sent3: The infusion of herbs in the soup gave it a unique and delicious taste.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the coffee infusion filled the room with a rich scent.
meanings.sent5: The infusion of mint in the tea refreshed her on a hot day.
